key_title: Key to the species of Nymphoides

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Dicotyledons
Key to the genera of Menyanthaceae

source.author: Aston, H.I.
source.title: Menyanthaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae
source.citation: From: Aston, H.I. (1999). Menyanthaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 4. Cornaceae to Asteraceae. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves entire or mildly crenate; corolla-lobes not keeled; placentas and stigmas usually 2, stigmas not decurrent; seed with a thin to prominent circular caruncle

Leaves mostly crenate to crenate-dentate; corolla-lobes each with a laciniate longitudinal keel on the inner surface; placentas and stigmas usually 5, stigmas decur- rent on the style; seed without a caruncle
Flowers heterostylous; seed ellipsoid but strongly laterally compressed, 1.1–1.55 mm long, usually smooth or else with prominent fine acute tubercles
Flowers homostylous; seed more or less globular but slightly laterally compressed, 0.6–0.95 mm long, usually bearing prominent broad obtuse tubercles
Leaves mostly entire, uniformly green above; seeds usually smooth, rarely with minute obtuse tubercles

Leaves mostly mildly crenate but often entire, upper surface with a cyclamen-coloured spot at the point of petiole insertion and often mottled in greens and maroon-browns; seeds with prominent fine acute tubercles
